abstract.shortdesc: Attempts to change the state of an instance of a service.
abstract.note: The euserv-modify-service command replaces the deprecated euca-modify-service command.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock:
euserv-modify-service -s STATE [-U URL] [--region USER@REGION]
[-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--security-token TOKEN] [--debug] [--debugger] [--version] [-h] SVCINSTANCE

row.entry: The name of the service instance to modify.

section.title: Output
section.p: No output is given. You can run the euserv-describe-services command to verify that the modification completed successfully, as shown in the example following.

section.title: Example
section.p: To modify the state of a storage controller service named "two-sc-1" to stopped:
section.codeblock: euserv-modify-service -s stopped two-sc-1 euserv-describe-services --filter service-type=storage SERVICE storage one one-sc-1 enabled SERVICE storage two two-sc-1 stopped
section.note: In order to modify the status of snapshots and volumes in zones that have unavailable zones, use a cloud with two zones and stop the storage controller on one of the zones. There must be a volume and snapshot created on each zone before you can modify their statuses.
